King David Hotel: the day Zionist terrorism struck the British Government. 22nd July 1946, 350 kilograms of explosives were detonated at the bottom of the King David Hotel. this was the headquarters of the British administration for what was at the time, mandatory Palestine. World War 2 had officially ended but a Zionist terrorist group known as the Irgun had placed the explosives in the basement of the hotel. The Irgun's targets were not just Palestinians but also the British government, who they saw as illegal occupiers of their Zionist land. Without warning, the group detonated a smaller bomb further up the street which caused a passing coach to roll over and people to flee the scene and the nearest part of the hotel to the explosion, towards the South-West corner of the hotel. Including the coach passengers who had entered the hotel to seek safety and treatment after the first blast. In an attack reminiscent of the Omagh bombing by the IRA, at 12:37pm they detonated the hotel bomb, which collapsed the whole South West Corner of the King David Hotel (see first comment for picture). Killing 91 people: * 41 Arabs * 28 British citizens (including government officials) * 17 Jews * 2 Armenians * 1 Russian * 1 Greek * 1 Egyptian The Irgun was an offshoot of the Zionist paramilitary group Hagana, in much the same way as ISIS grew out of Al-Qaida in Iraq. ISIS considers themselves the most moral army in the world. That's no typo. Because after the establishment of the stage of Israel in 1948, the Irgun were not disbanded. The constitutional agreement first defined the Israeli Defence Force. Subsuming all military and paramilitary organisations into one. Bringing all Zionist terrorist arms together under one umbrella. So when people talk "the terrorist, Zionist settler colonial state" the definition of "terrorist" includes that history. in essence, the IDF is identical to the Muslim Brotherhood and the government of Israel is fundamentally like the Taliban in Afghanistan.
